name: 尤信程
objective:
1. Discrete representations of signals and systems
2. Difference equations and solutions
3. Convolutions and stability
4. DFT and FFT
5. Z transform and transfer functions
6. Filter design
schedule:
Week 1: 　　Holiiday
Week 2,3:
Introduction to digital signal processing
Review of linear systems
Overview of linear systems
Solutions to linear difference equations
Impulse response
Convolution derived from linearity
Stability issues
Week 4,5: 
Discrete-time Fourier transform
Fourier transform vs. Discrete-time Fourier transform
Properties of DTFT
Examples & applications of DTFT
Week 6,7: 
Sampling and reconstruction
Concept of sampling and aliasing
Concept of reconstruction (Sampling theorem)
A/D, D/A, and analog filters
Quantization noise
Design issues
Week 8,10,11:
Discrete Fourier transform
DFT concept
DFT properties
Circular convolution
Overlap-add (OVLA) algorithm
FFT algorithms
Linear convolution via FFT and OVLA
Week 9:
MT & sol
Week 12:　　 
Spectral analysis
Effects of various types of windows (main-lobe/side-lobe)
Uncertainty principle
Week 13,14: 
Z-transform
Properties
Solving difference equations via Z-transform
Transfer function and stability issues
Week 15,16: 
Introduction to Digital filters
Design of FIR filters via window method
Concept of linear phase
Design of IIR filters via bilinear transform
Programming issues
Week 17 
Advanced topics
Week 18 Final exam
materials:
Lecture notes available.
We’ll assign a textbook. But the textbook is for your reference only. You may choose not to purchase the textbook as long as you have a good reference book. Suggested textbook:
Sanjit Mitra, Digital Signal Processing, A Computer-Based Approach
